_header: In name of him which that is monarch
Subjects: charters; Bury St Edmund’s, Benedictine abbey of
_description: Rhymed Charters of English Kings presented to the Abbey of Bury, probably by Lydgate — ninety-eight rhyme royal stanzas

BLAdd14848.First Lines: In name of hym whiche that is monarkeof heuene & erthe mankyndes savyour…
BLAdd14848.Last Lines: …And for tavoyde al ambyguyteHere set in ordre ther namys ye may se
BLAdd14848.Note:
MS refoliated, formerly listed in Brown  and  Robbins (1943)
XCarleton Fairchild Brown,   and  Rossell Hope Robbins.  
             The Index of Middle English Verse.
         New York: Printed for the Index Society by Columbia University Press,
            1943 as f. 243; followed by list of names in Latin, beginning “Ego vulstanus Archiepiscope consensi” (ff. 246-246v).
BLAdd14848.Editions:
Arnold,  Thomas,
                        ed.  
             Memorials of St. Edmund’s Abbey.
             3 vols. 
             Rolls Series
         96 (1890-96); repr. Kraus, 1965): 3.215-37.
